## Rhesus Immune Reference Atlas (RIRA): A multi-tissue single-cell landscape of immune cells

## Table of Contents

- [Overview](#overview)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [Download RIRA
  Data](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/articles/GetRira.html)

### Overview

RIRA is a multi-tissue single-cell RNA-seq atlas from Rhesus macaque
cells, including data from 7 tissues and 47 animals. It provides highly
annotated reference data, and a number of pipelines to assign cell type
to your data using RIRA’s built-in models. Finally, it includes
pipelines to replicate the process used to generate RIRA’s reference
labels, which might be useful for generating a similar reference for
another species.

The raw expression data are available, including a seurat object,
through the NIH GEO database under accession
[GSE277821](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE277821).

[Please see our documentation for more detail and usage
examples](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/)

### Installation

    # Make sure to update your Rprofile to include Bioconductor repos, such as adding this line to ~/.Rprofile:
    local({options(repos = BiocManager::repositories())})

    #Latest version:
    devtools::install_github(repo = 'bimberlab/RIRA', ref = 'master', dependencies = TRUE, upgrade = 'always')

Pre-packaged Docker images with all needed dependencies installed can be
found on our [GitHub Packages
page](https://github.com/orgs/bimberlab/RIRA/pkgs/container/rira):

    docker pull ghcr.io/bimberlab/rira:latest

# Package index

## All functions

- [`AssignCellType()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/AssignCellType.md)
  : Assigns celltype label based on probabilities in the metadata
- [`CalculateUCellScores()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/CalculateUCellScores.md)
  : CalculateUCellScores
- [`Classify_ImmuneCells()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/Classify_ImmuneCells.md)
  : Classify Bulk Immune cells
- [`Classify_Myeloid()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/Classify_Myeloid.md)
  : Classify T/NK
- [`Classify_TNK()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/Classify_TNK.md)
  : Classify T/NK
- [`CombineTcellActivationClasses()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/CombineTcellActivationClasses.md)
  : Combine T cell activation classes using custom logic
- [`DownloadFromGEO()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/DownloadFromGEO.md)
  : Download RIRA data from GEO
- [`ExpandGeneList()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/ExpandGeneList.md)
  : ExpandGeneList
- [`ExtractGeneWeights()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/ExtractGeneWeights.md)
  : ExtractGeneWeights
- [`FilterDisallowedClasses()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/FilterDisallowedClasses.md)
  : Filter Disallowed Classes
- [`GetActivationClassMapping()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/GetActivationClassMapping.md)
  : GetActivationClassMapping
- [`GetAvailableScGates()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/GetAvailableScGates.md)
  : GetAvailableScGates
- [`GetGeneSet()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/GetGeneSet.md)
  : GetGeneSet
- [`GetMMul10IgGenes()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/GetMMul10IgGenes.md)
  : GetMMul10IgGenes
- [`GetMMul10TcrGenes()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/GetMMul10TcrGenes.md)
  : GetMMul10TcrGenes
- [`GetScGateModel()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/GetScGateModel.md)
  : GetScGateModel
- [`GetSeed()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/GetSeed.md) :
  Get random seed
- [`InterpretModels()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/InterpretModels.md)
  : Interprets the feature importance of each model
- [`ListGeneSets()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/ListGeneSets.md)
  : ListGeneSets
- [`MakePhenotypingDotPlot()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/MakePhenotypingDotPlot.md)
  : MakePhenotypingDotPlot
- [`PlotImmuneMarkers()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/PlotImmuneMarkers.md)
  : PlotImmuneMarkers
- [`PlotMarkerSeries()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/PlotMarkerSeries.md)
  : PlotMarkerSeries
- [`PlotUcellCorrelation()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/PlotUcellCorrelation.md)
  : PlotUcellCorrelation
- [`PredictCellTypeProbability()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/PredictCellTypeProbability.md)
  : Applies trained models to get celltype probabilities
- [`PredictTcellActivation()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/PredictTcellActivation.md)
  : Predicts T cell activation using sPLS derived components and a
  trained logistic model on transformed variates
- [`RunCellTypist()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/RunCellTypist.md)
  : Run Celltypist
- [`RunScGate()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/RunScGate.md)
  : Run scGate
- [`RunScGateForModels()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/RunScGateForModels.md)
  : Run scGate for models
- [`RunScGateWithDefaultModels()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/RunScGateWithDefaultModels.md)
  : Run scGate With DefaultModels
- [`RunScGateWithRhesusModels()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/RunScGateWithRhesusModels.md)
  : Run scGate using Rhesus macaque models
- [`ScoreCellsWithSavedModel()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/ScoreCellsWithSavedModel.md)
  : Applies a trained binary classifier to get per-cell probabilities.
- [`ScoreUsingSavedComponent()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/ScoreUsingSavedComponent.md)
  : ScoreUsingSavedComponent
- [`SetSeed()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/SetSeed.md) :
  Set random seed
- [`TrainCellTypist()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/TrainCellTypist.md)
  : Train Celltypist
- [`TrainModel()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/TrainModel.md)
  : Creates a binary classifier to classify cells within a Seurat object
- [`TrainModelsFromSeurat()`](https://bimberlab.github.io/RIRA/reference/TrainModelsFromSeurat.md)
  : Wrapper function for TrainModel to train a suite of binary
  classifiers for each cell type present in the data
